description: Sets a record for the number of positive integers which, when added to the number of their divisors, gives n.
comments: Invented by the HR concept formation program.
links: S. Colton, Refactorable Numbers - A Machine Invention, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 2, 1999, #2.
S. Colton, HR - Automatic Theory Formation in Pure Mathematics
formula: Sets record for |{b in N : b + tau(b) = n}|.
example: 1 [ first with 0 ].2=1+tau(1) [ first with 1 ].7=4+tau(4) and 5+tau(5) [ first with 2 ].38=30+tau(30) and 32+tau(32) and 34+tau(34) [ first with 3 ].
prog: (PARI) nbi(n) = {nb = 0; for (i = 1, n, if ((i + numdiv(i)) == n, nb++);); nb;}lista(nn) = {rec = -1; for (n = 1, nn, new = nbi(n); if (new > rec, print1(n, ", "); rec = new;););} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Aug 31 2013
author: Simon Colton (simonco(AT)cs.york.ac.uk)
extensions: More terms from Julian Richardson (julianr(AT)dai.ed.ac.uk), who has searched up to 100000000.
